findings.title: Update all documentation related to the release process
findings.description: This finding recommends updating all documentation related to the release process to accurately reflect the latest version of the process.

findings.title: Require individuals with access to significant repositories or systems to use a smart card device to store sensitive key material
findings.description: Mandate the use of smart card devices that require physical touch to validate each smart card operation, especially for key individuals with access to significant repositories or systems.

findings.title: Smart Card Security Enhancement
findings.description: Mandate the use of smart card devices requiring physical touch to validate each operation for enhanced security.

findings.title: Lack of Documented Key Management Policies and Procedures
findings.description: There is no centralized, authoritative documentation laying out policies and procedures for key revocation, generation, or rotation or other key management tasks.

findings.title: Identify effective ways to widely advertise developers’ key fingerprints
findings.description: The finding recommends identifying effective ways to widely advertise developers' key fingerprints through various channels such as email signatures, mailing lists, and conference presentations.

findings.title: Use of older public-key algorithms and standards within web of trust
findings.description: PGP keys used by kernel developers vary significantly in terms of algorithm and key size, which can lead to subtle new failure modes. It is recommended to move away from RSA where possible in favor of elliptic curve algorithms.
